poll_list.title: Adjust the ETH-A Debt Ceiling - August 17, 2020

content.content: Over the weekend we saw a lot of Dai activity with the new CRV farming for Curve.fi. The good news is the peg is looking slightly better, but we’re also nearing the debt ceiling again. As has been the policy lately I think we should raise the ETH-A debt ceiling again by 80 million. There is significant demand for Dai minting right now (especially from ETH. USDC-A has dropped off). There will be a governance poll going out later today for this, but would be great to get some community thoughts as well. Given that the current utilization rate is so high, it would be good to get this to an exec vote as soon as possible IMO. Edit (LFW): Poll is now live.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to raise the ETH-A debt ceiling by 80 million due to significant demand for Dai minting. The author is asking for community thoughts on the proposal before a governance poll is released. The post also mentions that the current utilization rate is high and that an executive vote should be held as soon as possible.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None

content.content: I got so excited thinking this was RP increase lol. 80M sounds good. We’ll probably hit the current DC before Friday though…
Agreed!  However, is an ETH -B vault on the table as an alternative?

Any reason to not raise WBTC-A (to 100M?) and lower USDC-A (40M?) as well? There is a $130M buffer to be exploited if USDC fail and WBTC-A supply locked ratio is falling sharply so it shouldn’t be an issue to raise it. Collateral risk is more and more centralized around ETH.

content.content: Agreed, I’ve been checking in daistats, so far seems curve has been helping us  binance listing was great too. Ref other collaterals WBTC could be increased another 10m, there has been new minting, seems USDC has been taking advantage of the dai drop to close position, not entirely sure if that’s a good thing since they are still closing above 1.

content.content: Will definitely vote for a raise of the ETH-A debt ceiling.  80 million additional is good.
80M will not last for long. I suggest 120M or more.
I think there’d be support for a WBTC DC raise too.
Added the poll link to the OP. Worth noting this is a 24 hour poll, so please go vote
We may want to raise this tomorrow.  Ceiling is already hit.
I would vote YES for ETH, NO for WBTC but I won’t vote due to high fees and slow loading page. It also puzzles me why we wait for the ceiling to be hit before raising it???

content.content: Is this vote going to increase the debt ceiling to such an extent that it provides a existential risk to the Ethereum network if a failure of some kind were to occur? What are the alternatives that are available?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Spell has been executed, ETH-A DC has been increased to 420M DAI.

Hey @kjs welcome to the forum. I think this is very unlikely to prove an existential thread to the network. It increases the existential threat to Maker  in the event of a serious downturn, but that has always been true of increasing the ceiling. How do you imagine a failure here would impact the wider Ethereum network? The worst case I can imagine is all the collateral being locked, but I don’t see how that would have a technical impact outside of Maker.
